result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick A. Sangster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Illegal Articles to Inmate [Modifiers: Solicitation of, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 302.095(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to one another and any other sentence currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed recommended.  
Non evidence or non contraband may be released to Felicia Morales.
Requisite surcharge to be paid on ES.
Eligible for interstate compact. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case called: 3:47pm. INCLUDES 13CF848, 13CF983, 13CF1024, 14CF197. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Erik McFarland. Matter set for Motion on 13CF1024. Defendant makes statement re: withdrawal of attorney. Crt states Speedy Trial would be effective. Crt addresses Atty McFarland. Atty McFarland states if defendant wants him to withdraw that he would. Crt addresses Defendant further - breakdown in communication. Crt grants Atty McFarland's request to withdraw and Defendant's request for new counsel. Crt admonishes Defendant re: continuously appointing counsel. Crt orders Public Defenders Office to appoint counsel. JT set for next week will be off. Defendant makes statement re: discovery. Statements by State. Crt states JT will not be w/in Speedy Trial Demand.  Atty McFarland to contact PD's office.  Adjourned: 3:57pm.

Case called: 8:45am.  Clerk: Denise. INCLUDES 13CF848, 13CF983, 13CF1024, 14CF197. Information filed 14CF197. W/R. Plea: NOT GUILTY. Bond to Continue. Crt proceeds with Mtn for CI in 13CF1024. State in agreement of Mtn. Crt grants Mtn. Defendant wants to speak - Crt states Defendant should speak with counsel first. Atty McFalrand moves to withdraw as counsel. Defendant makes statement and objects for him to withdraw. Crt will not allow withdrawal at this time. Defendant makes further statements. Adjourned: 8:52am.

Case called: 11:41am.  Clerk: Denise. INCLUDES 12CF850, 12CF855, 13CF848, 13CF983, 13CF1024, 14CF197. State appears by ADA Lance Leonhard. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Ryan Lister. Matter set on 12CF850 & 12CF855 pursuant to ltr from Dept of Corrections re: JOC. State indicates sentence on the record was quite clear and has nothing further. Atty Lister makes statement. COURT clarifies sentence and ORDERS JOC AMENDED - 
12CF850 - Ct 1 (bj/felony)- WI State Prison Total of 6 yrs; Initial Confinement 3 yrs; Extended Supervision 3 yrs. Ct 2 (Operate w/out valid dl (2nd w/in 3yrs) - 30 days MCJ concurrent to ct 1. COURT ORDERS: 12CF855- Ct 1 (poss w/intent thc)- WI State Prison Total of 3 yrs & 6 months; Initial Confinement 1 yrs & 6 months; Extended Supervision 2 yrs. Ct 2 (felon poss firearms)- WI State Prison Total of 5 yrs; Initial Confinement 3 yrs; Extended Supervision 2 yrs. ALL COUNTS ARE CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER AND SENTENCE OF 12CF850 & 12CF855 IS CONSECUTIVE TO EACH OTHER. Total of Sentence is  11 yrs; 6 yrs Initial Confinement and 5 yrs Extended Supervision. 
Crt addresses Ntc of Mtn and Mtn to Withdrawn filed on 5/15/14. Atty Lister makes statement regarding Atty Lennon taking files. Court has been informed that Atty Lennon will not take appointment of counsel to represent. Defendant states he spoke with PD and was being evaluated. COURT grant Mto to Widhraw and signs Order. Crt states PD will appoint counsel on those matters. Defendant makes statement re: discovery. State indicates discovery is ready (prepaid files). Defendant makes statement re: no contact with F.M. State indicates counsel in F.M. files can address the no contact. Crt will sign an agreement when presented. 
DATES: Status Conference w/JA - 5/30/14 @ 1pm. to set Arraignment. Adjourned: 11:53am.
